snippet: Google, facing the prospect of European antitrust charges stemming from its search and advertising business, sent a letter to regulators in an effort to settle the case and avoid a potentially expensive dispute, reports James Kanter in Tuesday's New...
abstract: Google, facing the prospect of European antitrust charges stemming from its search and advertising business, sent a letter to regulators in an effort to settle the case and avoid a potentially expensive dispute, reports James Kanter in Tuesday's New York Times.

headline.main: To Avoid a Long Dispute, Google Offers to Settle a European Antitrust Case
